alert.note: Alert for North Bay Interior Mountains; North Bay Interior Valleys; Sonoma Coastal Range (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Frost Advisory issued March 24 at 2:33AM PDT until March 26 at 9:00AM PDT by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FROST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Temperatures 32 to 36 degrees will result in very cold mornings and may cause frost formation. * WHERE...Sonoma Coastal Range, North Bay Interior Mountains and North Bay Interior Valleys. * WHEN...From 4 AM Friday to 9 AM PDT Sunday. The hours of most concern will be 4 am to 9 am each morning. * IMPACTS...Residents in homes without power as well as the unsheltered or marginally sheltered population will be at risk in these cold early morning temperatures. Frost could kill sensitive outdoor vegetation if left uncovered. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Morning cold/frost will be possible Friday, Saturday and Sunday, with the coldest temperatures expected Sunday.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold.

area.areaDesc: North Bay Interior Mountains; North Bay Interior Valleys; Sonoma Coastal Range
